page.title: 03THE SOUTH COMMON RIDING
page.content: The Riding of the South Common for the first time this century took place on the 21st September. The Burgh Standard was carried out of the Town by the Standard Bearerwho led a calvalcade of 300 horses and riders. The route followed was the from Town Hall up to Buxton and then on to Lindean Reservoir. At Whitlaw they foolowed the Hollydean drove road and crossed the the main St Boswells road to take the bridle path to Midlem. From there they went by way of Chesterknowes, Alehouse, and Lilliesleaf. The return route was through the Riddell Estate, Greenhill Whitmuir, past the bottom of the Rig and then back to town.
